speaker: All
text_entry: SCENE VI. Rome. A public place.

speaker: All
text_entry: Enter SICINIUS and BRUTUS

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: We hear not of him, neither need we fear him;

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: His remedies are tame i' the present peace

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: And quietness of the people, which before

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Were in wild hurry. Here do we make his friends

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Blush that the world goes well, who rather had,

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Though they themselves did suffer by't, behold

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Dissentious numbers pestering streets than see

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Our tradesmen with in their shops and going

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: About their functions friendly.

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: We stood to't in good time.

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Enter MENENIUS

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Is this Menenius?

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: 'Tis he,'tis he: O, he is grown most kind of late.

speaker: Both Tribunes
text_entry: Hail sir!

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Hail to you both!

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Your Coriolanus

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Is not much miss'd, but with his friends:

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: The commonwealth doth stand, and so would do,

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Were he more angry at it.

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: All's well; and might have been much better, if

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: He could have temporized.

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Where is he, hear you?

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Nay, I hear nothing: his mother and his wife

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Hear nothing from him.

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Enter three or four Citizens

speaker: Citizens
text_entry: The gods preserve you both!

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: God-den, our neighbours.

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: God-den to you all, god-den to you all.

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: Ourselves, our wives, and children, on our knees,

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: Are bound to pray for you both.

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Live, and thrive!

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Farewell, kind neighbours: we wish'd Coriolanus

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Had loved you as we did.

speaker: Citizens
text_entry: Now the gods keep you!

speaker: Both Tribunes
text_entry: Farewell, farewell.

speaker: Both Tribunes
text_entry: Exeunt Citizens

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: This is a happier and more comely time

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Than when these fellows ran about the streets,

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Crying confusion.

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Caius Marcius was

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: A worthy officer i' the war; but insolent,

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: O'ercome with pride, ambitious past all thinking,

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Self-loving,--

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: And affecting one sole throne,

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Without assistance.

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: I think not so.

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: We should by this, to all our lamentation,

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: If he had gone forth consul, found it so.

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: The gods have well prevented it, and Rome

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Sits safe and still without him.

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Enter an AEdile

speaker: AEdile
text_entry: Worthy tribunes,

speaker: AEdile
text_entry: There is a slave, whom we have put in prison,

speaker: AEdile
text_entry: Reports, the Volsces with two several powers

speaker: AEdile
text_entry: Are enter'd in the Roman territories,

speaker: AEdile
text_entry: And with the deepest malice of the war

speaker: AEdile
text_entry: Destroy what lies before 'em.

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: 'Tis Aufidius,

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Who, hearing of our Marcius' banishment,

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Thrusts forth his horns again into the world;

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Which were inshell'd when Marcius stood for Rome,

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: And durst not once peep out.

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Come, what talk you

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Of Marcius?

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Go see this rumourer whipp'd. It cannot be

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: The Volsces dare break with us.

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Cannot be!

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: We have record that very well it can,

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: And three examples of the like have been

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Within my age. But reason with the fellow,

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Before you punish him, where he heard this,

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Lest you shall chance to whip your information

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: And beat the messenger who bids beware

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Of what is to be dreaded.

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Tell not me:

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: I know this cannot be.

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Not possible.

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Enter a Messenger

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: The nobles in great earnestness are going

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: All to the senate-house: some news is come

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: That turns their countenances.

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: 'Tis this slave;--

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Go whip him, 'fore the people's eyes:--his raising;

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Nothing but his report.

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Yes, worthy sir,

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: The slave's report is seconded; and more,

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: More fearful, is deliver'd.

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: What more fearful?

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: It is spoke freely out of many mouths--

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: How probable I do not know--that Marcius,

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Join'd with Aufidius, leads a power 'gainst Rome,

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: And vows revenge as spacious as between

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: The young'st and oldest thing.

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: This is most likely!

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Raised only, that the weaker sort may wish

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Good Marcius home again.

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: The very trick on't.

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: This is unlikely:

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: He and Aufidius can no more atone

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Than violentest contrariety.

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Enter a second Messenger

speaker: Second Messenger
text_entry: You are sent for to the senate:

speaker: Second Messenger
text_entry: A fearful army, led by Caius Marcius

speaker: Second Messenger
text_entry: Associated with Aufidius, rages

speaker: Second Messenger
text_entry: Upon our territories; and have already

speaker: Second Messenger
text_entry: O'erborne their way, consumed with fire, and took

speaker: Second Messenger
text_entry: What lay before them.

speaker: Second Messenger
text_entry: Enter COMINIUS

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: O, you have made good work!

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: What news? what news?

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: You have holp to ravish your own daughters and

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: To melt the city leads upon your pates,

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: To see your wives dishonour'd to your noses,--

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: What's the news? what's the news?

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Your temples burned in their cement, and

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Your franchises, whereon you stood, confined

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Into an auger's bore.

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Pray now, your news?

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: You have made fair work, I fear me.--Pray, your news?--

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: If Marcius should be join'd with Volscians,--

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: If!

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: He is their god: he leads them like a thing

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Made by some other deity than nature,

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: That shapes man better; and they follow him,

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Against us brats, with no less confidence

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Than boys pursuing summer butterflies,

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Or butchers killing flies.

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: You have made good work,

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: You and your apron-men; you that stood so up much

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: on the voice of occupation and

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: The breath of garlic-eaters!

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: He will shake

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Your Rome about your ears.

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: As Hercules

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Did shake down mellow fruit.

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: You have made fair work!

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: But is this true, sir?

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Ay; and you'll look pale

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Before you find it other. All the regions

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Do smilingly revolt; and who resist

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Are mock'd for valiant ignorance,

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: And perish constant fools. Who is't can blame him?

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Your enemies and his find something in him.

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: We are all undone, unless

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: The noble man have mercy.

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Who shall ask it?

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: The tribunes cannot do't for shame; the people

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Deserve such pity of him as the wolf

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Does of the shepherds: for his best friends, if they

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Should say 'Be good to Rome,' they charged him even

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: As those should do that had deserved his hate,

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: And therein show'd like enemies.

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: 'Tis true:

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: If he were putting to my house the brand

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: That should consume it, I have not the face

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: To say 'Beseech you, cease.' You have made fair hands,

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: You and your crafts! you have crafted fair!

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: You have brought

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: A trembling upon Rome, such as was never

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: So incapable of help.

speaker: Both Tribunes
text_entry: Say not we brought it.

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: How! Was it we? we loved him but, like beasts

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: And cowardly nobles, gave way unto your clusters,

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Who did hoot him out o' the city.

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: But I fear

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: They'll roar him in again. Tullus Aufidius,

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: The second name of men, obeys his points

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: As if he were his officer: desperation

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Is all the policy, strength and defence,

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: That Rome can make against them.

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Enter a troop of Citizens

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Here come the clusters.

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: And is Aufidius with him? You are they

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: That made the air unwholesome, when you cast

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Your stinking greasy caps in hooting at

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Coriolanus' exile. Now he's coming;

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: And not a hair upon a soldier's head

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Which will not prove a whip: as many coxcombs

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: As you threw caps up will he tumble down,

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: And pay you for your voices. 'Tis no matter;

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: if he could burn us all into one coal,

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: We have deserved it.

speaker: Citizens
text_entry: Faith, we hear fearful news.

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: For mine own part,

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: When I said, banish him, I said 'twas pity.

speaker: Second Citizen
text_entry: And so did I.

speaker: Third Citizen
text_entry: And so did I; and, to say the truth, so did very

speaker: Third Citizen
text_entry: many of us: that we did, we did for the best; and

speaker: Third Citizen
text_entry: though we willingly consented to his banishment, yet

speaker: Third Citizen
text_entry: it was against our will.

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Ye re goodly things, you voices!

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: You have made

speaker: MENENIUS
text_entry: Good work, you and your cry! Shall's to the Capitol?

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: O, ay, what else?

speaker: COMINIUS
text_entry: Exeunt COMINIUS and MENENIUS

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Go, masters, get you home; be not dismay'd:

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: These are a side that would be glad to have

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: This true which they so seem to fear. Go home,

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: And show no sign of fear.

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: The gods be good to us! Come, masters, let's home.

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: I ever said we were i' the wrong when we banished

speaker: First Citizen
text_entry: him.

speaker: Second Citizen
text_entry: So did we all. But, come, let's home.

speaker: Second Citizen
text_entry: Exeunt Citizens

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: I do not like this news.

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Nor I.

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Let's to the Capitol. Would half my wealth

speaker: BRUTUS
text_entry: Would buy this for a lie!

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Pray, let us go.

speaker: SICINIUS
text_entry: Exeunt
